name: Slackbot Destroyer
description: Slack bot which deletes auto responses from Slackbot.

BOT_ID.description: The ID of your Slack bot user, this is required so the bot knows when a command is directed at it. If you're unsure what your bot ID is you can run bot_id.py which will print the ID, you'll need to make sure that the BOT_NAME field within the file corresponds with the one you setup in the Slack interface.

SLACK_BOT_TOKEN.description: The bot token found within the Slack API settings.

SLACK_USER_TOKEN.description: The token for the user authorizing the bot.

AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.description: The access key ID for AWS. If you don't want to persist the bots settings outside of memory do not include this.

AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.description: The secret access key ID for AWS. If you don't want to persist the bots settings outside of memory do not include this.
